title: Big Hole National Battlefield: Webcams
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Webcams              Webcams                       Big Hole National Battlefield Web Camera The web cam at the Big Hole battlefield is attached to the visitor center and looks northeast across the battlefield. Dominating the background is Battle Mountain. On the slopes of this hill, the Nez Perce kept their horses. On the flat at the base of Battle Mountain is the north fork of the Big Hole River. If you look off to the right, you can see the tipi poles that mark and memorialize the village site that was attacked by Colonel John Gibbon early on the morning of August 9, 1877.   View webcam
